intro: Soehrensia huascha subsp. robusta, commonly known as the Huascha subsp. robusta, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many flowering plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
